summary: Coretta Scott King was the wife of Martin Luther King Jr. and a prominent civil rights activist in her own right. The documents primarily mention her in the context of FBI investigations into Martin Luther King Jr. and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC). One document specifically mentions the CIA seeking information from the FBI regarding her intention to participate in the Australian Vietnam Moratorium Campaign in 1970. The documents suggest that her activities and associations were of interest to U.S. intelligence agencies during the period of the Vietnam War and the Civil Rights Movement.
significance: While not directly related to the JFK assassination in these documents, Coretta King's significance lies in her connection to Martin Luther King Jr., who was himself a figure of interest to intelligence agencies. Her planned participation in the Australian Vietnam Moratorium Campaign also drew the attention of the CIA and FBI, indicating surveillance of her activities during a period of significant social and political unrest.
